subject: Coaching Fiasco?
event:
So now the rumor mill tells us that the leading candidate for the Jets' head coaching job is Doug Marrone, who just stepped down as coach of the Buffalo Bills, where we won... how many SuperBowls was it?  Oh.  Zero.  Well, how many playoff appearances?  Oh.  Zero.

Having dumped Rex, one of the best coaches in the NFL, will Gang Green reach out for mediocrity?

http://www.nydailynews.com/sports/football/jets/mehta-consultants-pushing-doug-marrone-jets-article-1.2062892

These are the Jets.  Maybe they will be smart this time around.  (Hah)

comments.article: Go Broncos! LOL!
comments.subject: Poor Jets...

comments.article:
They should have taken a shot at hiring Harbaugh.

Btw, your posts about NFL made me start watching it.
So...besides ASOIAF, thanks for that!

Cheers from Brazil.
comments.subject: Re: Poor Jets...

comments.article: There's just not many top-flight Coaches out there to choose from George..  Dan Quinn(Def Coord of Seahawks) and Todd Bowles (Def Coord of Cards)are worth looks.. My team is all set with Coaching, we have Belichick. Go Pats!
comments.subject: Jets Coaching

comments.article:
Since this is your first post of the New Year, I wish to wish you a Happy New Year, with nothing but the best! Hope all goes well in every aspect possible.

*raises beer and clinks it against your beverage of choice*.
As a Seahawks fan, I'm curious what you think of Harvin. Sure loved watching him play. Wish it could have worked out for us...
comments.subject: What are your thoughts on Harvin

comments.article: Going 9-7 or 8-8 in Buffalo is a pretty big achievement these days...

Rex took a really good Jets team and has made them worse each year. Don't blame the quarterbacks. HE picked Sanchez, HE picked Geno, HE brought in Vick, and none of them has worked out. Rex is the one wasting first round draft picks on these guys.

Rex is a great guy and has a much better personality than Bill B and other guys, but he's a D-Coordinator at best. He CLEARLY doesn't know how to work an offense.

Marrone just gave Buffalo their first winning season in 10 years! The Bills had finished 4th in your division for 6 years in a row.
comments.subject: Get a Grip

comments.article:
None of that is true. Rex was the coach, not the GM. Mike Tannenbaum drafter Sanchez, and Idzik is responsible for drafting Geno Smith and signing Mike Vick.

Rex worked miracles with what he was given.
comments.subject: Re: Get a Grip

comments.article: Will you be watching the post season, even without your teams playing?  If so, who will you be rooting for?
The Jets were not going anywhere with Idzik, though I agree with you about Ryan.  Possibly it was a metaphoric next chapter thing for the franchise, but I don't think it was the right move.
comments.subject: At least you'll get a new GM

comments.article: Now and then I think Jets fans are justified in bemoaning their fate. Then I remember, I'm a Vikings fan. At least your team won a freaking Super Bowl.
comments.subject: Jets

comments.article:
I cn really feel your pain. As a Ravens fan I've pretty much have to watch the team go from folly to outright breaking apart (especially after the Rice scandal. Although I really blame the NFL and the foolhardy commissioner for that).

This just reminds me of when Mark Sanchez went to the Jets those years ago and they began showing a lot of promise. He then became a bit lackluster (and then overshadowed by Aaron Rodgers but that's a different story) and the Jets devolved into what they are now.

The only consolation I can possibly give is that at least a new coach may possibly bring some new life into the team???



Also just curious, but why are you not a Bills fan? I usually find myself rooting for the Giants/Bills....and at least the Bills actually play in NY haha.
comments.subject: a revamp for the Jets.....

comments.article: Well, at least John Idzik got fired, so the next coach will probably have a little better talent next season. Of course, the Jets being the Jets, Woody Johnson could just replace Idzik with someone just as bad.

I am thoroughly convinced more than ever that there are two truisms in sports: 1) you cannot win in the NBA without a 'superstar' and 2) you cannot win in the NFL without a quarterback.

Marrone is a good coach, and he took the Bills to a fairly respectable place this year. But, he was saddled with a terrible quarterback situation (partly of his own creation with E.J. Manuel). If he takes over the Jets (or anyone for that matter), you still need a quarterback. Anyone coming into the Jets is going to do the same or slightly worse job as Rex because they don't have a quarterback. My belief is that they will do worse, because Rex is a superlative defense coach.

My hope beyond all hope is that we've seen the last of these "read option/running" quarterbacks. With one glaring exception in Seattle (and watch what happens when Beastmode isn't there anymore to see how the read option works), this doesn't work in the NFL. The Manuels, Geno Smiths, Johnny Manziel, Vince Young, etc., of the world should go to Canada where they belong. I want to watch "Pro" football, not a glorified college offensive scheme where you just put the ball in your hands of the best athlete and hope for the best.

As a Cowboys fan, I have better hopes for your Giants next year than you do. I will tell you that the NFL is better when the NFC East is competitive from top to bottom. Coughlin is a good coach. He'll fix the lines on both sides of the ball, and you'll be in the playoffs next year (especially with a 3rd place schedule).
comments.subject: Doug Marrone

comments.upictitle: jefF - Crazy Man with a Snake - ON A PLANE!: monkeys and footballs
comments.article:
Just hope you don't pick up Trestman. The last couple of years in Chicago have been downright painful and a textbook example of total wasted potential - I really can't remember any team with so much potential that did so little with it, and that's coming from a Cubs fan.

I'm actually hoping the Bears pick up Rex, given his father's history with the club. But since the Bears are replacing their GM first (as well they should), Rex will probably get picked up by someone else before that. Ah well, to dream of what could be.

Forget Marrone. Funny that the other user said "Go Broncos" because I think Jack Del Rio is the guy that ANYONE should pick up. He worked wonders with the Broncos D (Why is their OC receiving any look at all?) and did a much better job than people realize in Jacksonville. Start praying for Jack... plus a candidate off the Packers or Ravens GM tree.
comments.subject: Best Jets coaching candidate

comments.upictitle: metal_trooper: Bright light in the dark pink
comments.article:
As a Bills fan I can sympathize with you George. I'm happy he's gone. It seems that he left for a cash grab and the Jets job. He's prickly and reports say he was disgruntled with the Buffalo media. I don't know how he expects that to get any better in New York!

He's also a former offensive lineman and line coach, yet the Bills worst position this year was their line. They actually got adequate quarterbacking this year but their line was so bad that their running game took a huge step back. With better running, they would be playing this weekend.

As a Bills fan, I hope you get him. I like it when the Jets are a mess. Nothing personal.
comments.subject: Bills fan perspective

comments.article: ...I'd like to say "Sorry", but since the Jets are in the division, I can't. Marrone wasn't awful, and maybe he would have gotten better, but in two years he didn't accomplish much of anything, and most disconcerting was the fact that in two years, his area of supposed expertise (offense) got SIGNIFICANTLY worse. Why on Earth your team wants him is beyond me. But then, I thought Rex Ryan was stunningly overrated and would rather he stayed right where he was!
comments.subject: As a Bills fan....

comments.article: Well, here in Buffalo everybody's pretty mad that Marrone is leaving immediately after leading us to our winningest season since the Super Bowl years of the '90s. We'd be happy to keep him.

As a Bills fan from Buffalo many of us fans, including many from the local sports media, are not sad to see Marrone go.  Wasn't flat out horrible, but not leading any team to a superbowl anytime soon.  Under this "offensive guru", we saw our offense actually regress (especially the o-line), while it was our defense winning us games (where Marrone left total control to the DC).

Sorry, George, but, selfishly, this Bills fan is just glad to see the back of Marrone.

(convenient icon is convenient)
At least you aren't a Raiders fan.
comments.subject: Look at the bright side George

comments.article:
And my 49ers are interviewing a winning Super Bowl Head Coach! Oh wait... That's right. The last time he won a Super Bowl I was still buying my music on cassettes, viewing movies on VHS, and trying to watch pornographic clips using a 56K modem.

Shanahan? No thank you!
Michigan alumni and lifetime fan...  Thanks! Seriously though, why on earth would they let Harbaugh go? He's done nothing but win games and exceed expectations out there.

"These are the Jets. Maybe they will be smart this time around."

You sweet summer child George. And your next gift will be Jameis. Enjoy!

But in all seriousness, I've seen raging dumpster fires that look down on the Jets.
comments.subject: These are the Jets!

comments.article: Gase, Bowles, Quinn, and Kubiak are all excellent coaches available for the vacancy. Coming from a Lions fan, I'd be more concerned with the GM vacancy - without a quality one you can spend decades in the dark.
comments.subject: Options Galore

comments.article: I remember when USC hired Pete Carroll I thought , what has he ever done? What a loser as a Jets coach! I was dead wrong. The Jets front office made the huge mistake of taking Quarterbacks in the first round twice when the jets should have stuck with Sanchez & traded down to get some more 2nd & 3rd round picks.
comments.subject: re: Coaches

comments.article:
From everything I've read / heard about Marrone, I like the guy. He did a nice job turning around Syracuse after they had been absolutely terrible for years before he arrived (and they're terrible again after he's left). Then I give him a lot of credit for what he did with Buffalo going 9-7 with Orton and EJ Manuel leading the way at QB. As you know, Buffalo is a train wreck of a franchise and hadn't had a record as good as that since 2004.

What I was most concerned about him is that he was on board with drafting of EJ Manuel, which is one of the worst picks in recent memory. I just a heard a report though that said last spring at the draft Marrone stormed out of the room when the GM decided to trade a future first rounder to move up to draft Sammy Watkins (disgusting trade, the GM mortgaged the future of the franchise because his job was on the line). Marrone wanted a QB. I think that tells me he was at odds with the GM, and I give him credit for getting the hell out of a toxic situation.

I think this could turn out to be alright George.
He didn't "turn around" Syracuse, he made them mediocre.  Same as he did with the Bills.  I don't want a coach who can bring the Jets to a .500 record, I want one who can lead them to the SuperBowl.
